meanings.sent1: The picture became muzzier as I moved away from it.
meanings.sent2: The fog made everything look muzzier than usual.
meanings.sent3: Trying to read with foggy glasses just made the words muzzier.
meanings.sent4: Her memory of the event was muzzier than a watercolor painting.
meanings.sent5: The old photograph had become muzzier over time, losing its sharpness.

meanings.definition: (verb) To make something less clear or distinct.
meanings.sent1: The smudged ink muzzier the writing on the paper.
meanings.sent2: The rain started to muzzier the outlines of the drawing.
meanings.sent3: He tried to muzzier his handwriting to hide his mistakes.
meanings.sent4: The artist intentionally muzziered the edges of the painting for a dreamy effect.
meanings.sent5: The fog began to muzzier the view, making it hard to see beyond.

meanings.definition: (adverb) In a confused or unclear manner.
meanings.sent1: She looked around muzzier, unsure of where she was.
meanings.sent2: The instructions were written muzzier, causing confusion among the students.
meanings.sent3: He answered the question muzzier than expected, leading to laughter in the class.
meanings.sent4: The music played muzzier, as if coming from a distant memory.
meanings.sent5: The lights flickered muzzier in the dimly lit room, creating a mysterious atmosphere.
